edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Level

  • public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    Level provides a broad, public, declarative interface to the core functionality of LibLOL.

    Game designers will spend most of their time in the display function of the various ScreenManager objects that comprise the game (i.e., Chooser, Help, Levels, Splash, Store). Within that function, a Level object is available. It corresponds to a pre-configured, blank, interactive portion of the game. By calling functions on the level, a programmer can realize their game.

    Conceptually, a Level consists of many screens:

    • MainScreen: This is where the Actors of the game are drawn
      • -
    • Hud: A heads-up display onto which text and input controls can be drawn
      • -
    • PreScene: A quick scene to display before the level starts
      • -
    • PostScene (WinScene or LoseScene): Two quick scenes to display at the end of the level
      • -
    • PauseScene: A scene to show when the game is paused

        public void setTimerCallback(float howLong,
                             float interval,
                             LolAction callback)

        Parameters:

      • setScribbleMode

        public void setScribbleMode(java.lang.String imgName,
                            float width,
                            float height,
                            int interval,
                            LolActorEvent onCreateCallback)
        Turn on scribble mode, so that scene touch events draw circular objects

        Note: this code should be thought of as serving to demonstrate, only. If you really wanted to do anything clever with scribbling, you'd certainly want to change this code.

        Parameters:
        imgName - The name of the image to use for scribbling
        width - Width of the individual components of the scribble
        height - Height of the individual components of the scribble
        interval - Time (in milliseconds) that must transpire between scribble events... use this to avoid outrageously high rates of scribbling
        onCreateCallback - A callback to run in order to modify the scribble behavior. The obstacle that is drawn in the scribble will be the "AttachedActor" of the callback.

      • setZoom

        Parameters:

      • setVictoryEnemyCount

        public void setVictoryEnemyCount()
        Indicate that the level is won by defeating all the enemies. This version is useful if the number of enemies isn't known, or if the goal is to defeat all enemies before more are are created.

      • setVictoryEnemyCount

        Parameters:
        howMany - The number of enemies that must be defeated to win the level

      • updateTimerExpiration

        public void updateTimerExpiration(float delta)
        Change the amount of time left in a countdown timer
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of time to add before the timer expires

      • getDistance

        public int getDistance()
        Report the total distance the hero has traveled

      • getStopwatch

        public int getStopwatch()
        Report the stopwatch value

      • getEnemiesDefeated

        public int getEnemiesDefeated()
        Report the number of enemies that have been defeated

      • winLevel

        public void winLevel()
        Force the level to end in victory

        This is useful in callbacks, where we might want to immediately end the game

      • loseLevel

        public void loseLevel()
        Force the level to end in defeat

        This is useful in callbacks, where we might want to immediately end the game

      • resetGravity

        public void resetGravity(float newXGravity,
                         float newYGravity)
        Change the gravity in a running level
        Parameters:
        newXGravity - The new X gravity
        newYGravity - The new Y gravity

      • enableTilt

        public void enableTilt(float xGravityMax,
                       float yGravityMax)
        Turn on accelerometer support so that tilt can control actors in this level
        Parameters:
        xGravityMax - Max X force that the accelerometer can produce
        yGravityMax - Max Y force that the accelerometer can produce

      • disableTilt

        public void disableTilt()
        Turn off accelerometer support so that tilt stops controlling actors in this level

      • setTiltAsVelocity

        public void setTiltAsVelocity(boolean toggle)
        This method lets us change the behavior of tilt, so that instead of applying a force, we directly set the velocity of objects using the accelerometer data.
        Parameters:
        toggle - This should usually be false. Setting it to true means that tilt does not cause forces upon objects, but instead the tilt of the phone directly sets velocities

      • setGravityMultiplier

        public void setGravityMultiplier(float multiplier)
        Use this to make the accelerometer more or less responsive, by multiplying accelerometer values by a constant.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - The constant that should be multiplied by the accelerometer data. This can be a fraction, like 0.5f, to make the accelerometer less sensitive

      • DisplayFixedText

        public TextProducer DisplayFixedText(java.lang.String text)
        Generate text that doesn't change

        Parameters:
        h - The hero whose strength is to be displayed
        Returns:
        A TextProducer, which can be passed to addDisplay

        A TextProducer, which can be passed to addDisplay

        Note: This distance will also become the Distance Score for the level.

        Parameters:
        actor - The actor whose distance is being monitored
        Returns:
        A TextProducer, which can be passed to addDisplay

      • addDisplay

        public edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Renderable addDisplay(float x,
                                                float y,
                                                java.lang.String fontName,
                                                java.lang.String fontColor,
                                                int size,
                                                java.lang.String prefix,
                                                java.lang.String suffix,
                                                TextProducer tp,
                                                int zIndex)
        Place some text on the screen. The text will be generated by tp, which is called on every screen render
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        fontName - The name of the font to use
        size - The font size
        tp - The TextProducer
        Returns:
        The display, so that it can be controlled further if needed

        public void setLoseCountdown(float timeout,
                             java.lang.String text)
        Indicate that the level will end in defeat if it is not completed in a given amount of time.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The amount of time until the level will end in defeat
        text - The text to display when the level ends in defeat TODO: make second parameter a callback?

                            java.lang.String text)

        Parameters:
        timeout - The amount of time until the level will end in victory
        text - The text to display when the level ends in victory

      • setStopwatch

        public void setStopwatch(float newVal)
        Set the current value of the stopwatch. Use -100 to disable the stopwatch, otherwise it will start counting immediately.
        Parameters:
        newVal - The new value of the stopwatch

      • addTapControl

        public SceneActor addTapControl(float x,
                                float y,
                                float width,
                                float height,
                                java.lang.String imgName,
                                TouchEventHandler action)
        Add a button that pauses the game (via a single tap) by causing a PauseScene to be displayed. Note that you must configure a PauseScene, or pressing this button will cause your game to crash.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button

      • JumpAction

        public TouchEventHandler JumpAction(Hero hero)
        Create an action that makes a hero jump. This action can be used as the action taken on a Control tap.
        Parameters:
        hero - The hero who we want to jump
        Returns:
        The action object

      • ThrowFixedAction

        public TouchEventHandler ThrowFixedAction(Hero hero,
                                          float offsetX,
                                          float offsetY,
                                          float velocityX,
                                          float velocityY)
        Create an action that makes a hero throw a projectile
        Parameters:
        hero - The hero who should throw the projectile
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        velocityX - The X velocity of the projectile when it is thrown
        velocityY - The Y velocity of the projectile when it is thrown

      • ThrowDirectionalAction

        public TouchEventHandler ThrowDirectionalAction(Hero hero,
                                                float offsetX,
                                                float offsetY)
        Create an action that makes a hero throw a projectile in a direction that relates to how the screen was touched
        Parameters:
        hero - The hero who should throw the projectile
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile

        Parameters:
        maxZoom - The maximum zoom factor to allow

        Parameters:

      • addToggleButton

        public SceneActor addToggleButton(int x,
                                  int y,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  java.lang.String imgName,
                                  LolAction whileDownAction,
                                  LolAction onUpAction)
        Add a button that has one behavior while it is being pressed, and another when it is released
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        whileDownAction - The action to execute, repeatedly, whenever the button is pressed
        onUpAction - The action to execute once any time the button is released
        Returns:
        The control, so we can do more with it as needed.

                                   float xRate)

        Parameters:

        xRate - The rate at which the actor should move in the X direction (negative values are allowed)

        public LolAction makeXYMotionAction(WorldActor actor,
                                    float xRate,
                                    float yRate)
        Create an action for moving an actor in the X and Y directions. This action can be used by a Control.
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor to move
        xRate - The rate at which the actor should move in the X direction (negative values are allowed)
        yRate - The rate at which the actor should move in the Y direction (negative values are allowed)
        Returns:
        The action

      • makeXYDampenedMotionAction

        public LolAction makeXYDampenedMotionAction(WorldActor actor,
                                            float xRate,
                                            float yRate,
                                            float dampening)
        Create an action for moving an actor in the X and Y directions, with dampening on release. This action can be used by a Control.
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor to move
        xRate - The rate at which the actor should move in the X direction (negative values are allowed)
        yRate - The rate at which the actor should move in the Y direction (negative values are allowed)
        dampening - The dampening factor
        Returns:
        The action

      • makeRepeatThrow

        public LolAction makeRepeatThrow(Hero hero,
                                 int milliDelay,
                                 float offsetX,
                                 float offsetY,
                                 float velocityX,
                                 float velocityY)
        Create an action for making a hero throw a projectile
        Parameters:
        hero - The hero who should throw the projectile
        milliDelay - A delay between throws, so that holding doesn't lead to too many throws at once
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        velocityX - The X velocity of the projectile when it is thrown
        velocityY - The Y velocity of the projectile when it is thrown
        Returns:
        The action object

      • addDirectionalThrowButton

        public SceneActor addDirectionalThrowButton(int x,
                                            int y,
                                            int width,
                                            int height,
                                            java.lang.String imgName,
                                            Hero h,
                                            long milliDelay,
                                            float offsetX,
                                            float offsetY)
        The default behavior for throwing is to throw in a straight line. If we instead desire that the projectiles have some sort of aiming to them, we need to use this method, which throws toward where the screen was pressed

        Note: you probably want to use an invisible button that covers the screen...

        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        h - The hero who should throw the projectile
        milliDelay - A delay between throws, so that holding doesn't lead to too many throws at once
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile

      • addPinchZoomControl

        public SceneActor addPinchZoomControl(float x,
                                      float y,
                                      float width,
                                      float height,
                                      java.lang.String imgName,
                                      float maxZoom,
                                      float minZoom)
        Allow pinch-to-zoom
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        maxZoom - The maximum zoom (out) factor. 8 is usually a good choice.
        minZoom - The minimum zoom (int) factor. .25f is usually a good choice.

        public SceneActor addPanCallbackControl(float x,
                                        float y,
                                        float width,
                                        float height,
                                        java.lang.String imgName,
                                        TouchEventHandler upCB,
                                        TouchEventHandler dnCB,
                                        TouchEventHandler mvCB)
        Add a control with callbacks for down, up, and pan
        Parameters:

        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        upCB - The callback to run when the Control is released
        dnCB - The callback to run when the Control is pressed
        mvCB - The callback to run when there is a finger move (pan) on the Control

      • getLevelFact

        public int getLevelFact(java.lang.String factName,
                        int defaultVal)
        Look up a fact that was stored for the current level. If no such fact exists, defaultVal will be returned.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name used to store the fact
        defaultVal - The default value to use if the fact cannot be found
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding to the last value stored

      • putLevelFact

        public void putLevelFact(java.lang.String factName,
                         int factValue)
        Save a fact about the current level. If the factName has already been used for this level, the new value will overwrite the old.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name for the fact being saved
        factValue - The integer value that is the fact being saved

      • getSessionFact

        public int getSessionFact(java.lang.String factName,
                          int defaultVal)
        Look up a fact that was stored for the current game session. If no such fact exists, -1 will be returned.
        Parameters:
        factName - The name used to store the fact
        defaultVal - The default value to use if the fact cannot be found
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding to the last value stored

        factName - The name for the fact being saved
        factValue - The integer value that is the fact being saved

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(java.lang.String color)
        Set the background color for the current level
        Parameters:

      • addHorizontalBackgroundLayer

        public void addHorizontalBackgroundLayer(float xSpeed,
                                         float ySpeed,
                                         java.lang.String imgName,
                                         float yOffset,
                                         float width,
                                         float height)
        Add a picture that may repeat in the X dimension
        Parameters:
        xSpeed - Speed that the picture seems to move in the X direction. "1" is the same speed as the hero; "0" is not at all; ".5f" is at half the hero's speed
        ySpeed - Speed that the picture seems to move in the Y direction. "1" is the same speed as the hero; "0" is not at all; ".5f" is at half the hero's speed
        imgName - The name of the image file to use as the background
        yOffset - The default is to draw the image at y=0. This field allows the picture to be moved up or down.
        width - The width of the image being used as a background layer
        height - The height of the image being used as a background layer

      • addHorizontalAutoBackgroundLayer

        public void addHorizontalAutoBackgroundLayer(float xSpeed,
                                             java.lang.String imgName,
                                             float yOffset,
                                             float width,
                                             float height)
        Add a picture that may repeat in the X dimension, and which moves automatically
        Parameters:
        xSpeed - Speed, in pixels per second
        imgName - The name of the image file to use as the background
        yOffset - The default is to draw the image at y=0. This field allows the picture to be moved up or down.
        width - The width of the image being used as a background layer
        height - The height of the image being used as a background layer

      • addVerticalBackgroundLayer

        public void addVerticalBackgroundLayer(float xSpeed,
                                       float ySpeed,
                                       java.lang.String imgName,
                                       float xOffset,
                                       float width,
                                       float height)
        Add a picture that may repeat in the Y dimension
        Parameters:
        xSpeed - Speed that the picture seems to move in the X direction. "1" is the same speed as the hero; "0" is not at all; ".5f" is at half the hero's speed
        ySpeed - Speed that the picture seems to move in the Y direction. "1" is the same speed as the hero; "0" is not at all; ".5f" is at half the hero's speed
        imgName - The name of the image file to use as the background
        xOffset - The default is to draw the image at x=0. This field allows the picture to be moved left or right.
        width - The width of the image being used as a background layer
        height - The height of the image being used as a background layer

      • makeEnemyAsPolygon

        public Enemy makeEnemyAsPolygon(float x,
                                float y,
                                float width,
                                float height,
                                java.lang.String imgName,
                                float... verts)
        Draw an enemy with an underlying polygon shape
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - Y coordinate of the bottom left corner
        width - Width of the obstacle
        height - Height of the obstacle
        imgName - Name of image file to use
        verts - Up to 16 coordinates representing the vertexes of this polygon, listed as x0,y0,x1,y1,x2,y2,...
        Returns:
        The enemy, so that it can be further modified

                                           float height,
                                           java.lang.String imgName)
        Make a destination that has an underlying circular shape.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom right corner
        width - The width of the destination
        height - The height of the destination
        imgName - The name of the image to display
        Returns:
        The destination, so that it can be modified further

      • makeObstacleAsBox

        public Obstacle makeObstacleAsBox(float x,
                                  float y,
                                  float width,
                                  float height,
                                  java.lang.String imgName)

        width - Width of the obstacle
        height - Height of the obstacle
        imgName - Name of image file to use
        Returns:
        The obstacle, so that it can be further modified

      • makeObstacleAsPolygon

        public Obstacle makeObstacleAsPolygon(float x,
                                      float y,
                                      float width,
                                      float height,
                                      java.lang.String imgName,
                                      float... verts)
        Draw an obstacle with an underlying polygon shape
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - Y coordinate of the bottom left corner
        width - Width of the obstacle
        height - Height of the obstacle
        imgName - Name of image file to use
        verts - Up to 16 coordinates representing the vertexes of this polygon, listed as x0,y0,x1,y1,x2,y2,...
        Returns:
        The obstacle, so that it can be further modified

      • setProjectileRange

        public void setProjectileRange(float distance)
        Specify a limit on how far away from the Hero a projectile can go. Without this, projectiles could keep on traveling forever.
        Parameters:
        distance - Maximum distance from the hero that a projectile can travel

      • setProjectileGravityOn

        public void setProjectileGravityOn()
        Indicate that projectiles should feel the effects of gravity. Otherwise, they will be (more or less) immune to gravitational forces.

      • setProjectileImageSource

        public void setProjectileImageSource(java.lang.String imgName)
        Specify the image file from which to randomly choose projectile images
        Parameters:
        imgName - The file to use when picking images

        TODO: this is broken now that we removed Animatable images

      • setProjectileVectorDampeningFactor

        public void setProjectileVectorDampeningFactor(float factor)
        The "directional projectile" mechanism might lead to the projectiles moving too fast. This will cause the speed to be multiplied by a factor
        Parameters:
        factor - The value to multiply against the projectile speed.

      • enableCollisionsForProjectiles

        public void enableCollisionsForProjectiles()
        Indicate that all projectiles should participate in collisions, rather than disappearing when they collide with other actors

      • setFixedVectorThrowVelocityForProjectiles

        public void setFixedVectorThrowVelocityForProjectiles(float velocity)
        Indicate that projectiles thrown with the "directional" mechanism should have a fixed velocity
        Parameters:
        velocity - The magnitude of the velocity for projectiles

      • setRotateVectorThrowForProjectiles

        public void setRotateVectorThrowForProjectiles()
        Indicate that projectiles thrown via the "directional" mechanism should be rotated to face in their direction or movement

      • setCollisionOkForProjectiles

        public void setCollisionOkForProjectiles()
        Indicate that when two projectiles collide, they should both remain on screen

      • configureProjectiles

        public void configureProjectiles(int size,
                                 float width,
                                 float height,
                                 java.lang.String imgName,
                                 int strength,
                                 int zIndex,
                                 boolean isCircle)
        Describe the behavior of projectiles in a scene. You must call this if you intend to use projectiles in your scene.
        Parameters:
        size - number of projectiles that can be thrown at once
        width - width of a projectile
        height - height of a projectile
        imgName - image to use for projectiles
        strength - specifies the amount of damage that a projectile does to an enemy
        zIndex - The z plane on which the projectiles should be drawn
        isCircle - Should projectiles have an underlying circle or box shape?

      • setNumberOfProjectiles

        public void setNumberOfProjectiles(int number)
        Set a limit on the total number of projectiles that can be thrown
        Parameters:
        number - How many projectiles are available

      • setThrowSound

        Specify a sound to play when the projectile is thrown
        Parameters:
        soundName - Name of the sound file to play

        Parameters:
        soundName - the name of the sound file to play

        Specify how projectiles should be animated
        Parameters:

      • drawBoundingBox

        public void drawBoundingBox(float x0,
                            float y0,
                            float x1,
                            float y1,
                            java.lang.String imgName,
                            float density,
                            float elasticity,
                            float friction)
        Draw a box on the scene Note: the box is actually four narrow rectangles
        Parameters:
        x0 - X coordinate of top left corner
        y0 - Y coordinate of top left corner
        x1 - X coordinate of bottom right corner
        y1 - Y coordinate of bottom right corner
        imgName - name of the image file to use when drawing the rectangles
        density - Density of the rectangle. When in doubt, use 1
        elasticity - Elasticity of the rectangle. When in doubt, use 0
        friction - Friction of the rectangle. When in doubt, use 1

      • importLineDrawing

        public void importLineDrawing(java.lang.String svgName,
                              float stretchX,
                              float stretchY,
                              float xposeX,
                              float xposeY,
                              Svg.ActorCallback ac)
        Load an SVG line drawing generated from Inkscape. The SVG will be loaded as a bunch of Obstacles. Note that not all Inkscape drawings will work as expected... if you need more power than this provides, you'll have to modify Svg.java
        Parameters:
        svgName - Name of the svg file to load. It should be in the assets folder
        stretchX - Stretch the drawing in the X dimension by this percentage
        stretchY - Stretch the drawing in the Y dimension by this percentage
        xposeX - Shift the drawing in the X dimension. Note that shifting occurs after stretching
        xposeY - Shift the drawing in the Y dimension. Note that shifting occurs after stretching
        ac - A callback for customizing each (obstacle) line segment of the SVG

      • toggleMute

        public void toggleMute()
        Use this to manage the state of Mute

      • getVolume

        public boolean getVolume()
        Use this to determine if the game is muted or not. True corresponds to not muted, false corresponds to muted.

      • drawPicture

        public void drawPicture(float x,
                        float y,
                        float width,
                        float height,
                        java.lang.String imgName,
                        int zIndex)
        Draw a picture on the current level

        Note: the order in which this is called relative to other actors will determine whether they go under or over this picture.

        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of bottom left corner
        y - Y coordinate of bottom left corner
        width - Width of the picture
        height - Height of this picture
        imgName - Name of the picture to display
        zIndex - The z index of the image. There are 5 planes: -2, -2, 0, 1, and 2. By default, everything goes to plane 0

      • addText

        public edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Renderable addText(float x,
                                             float y,
                                             java.lang.String fontName,
                                             java.lang.String fontColor,
                                             int fontSize,
                                             java.lang.String prefix,
                                             java.lang.String suffix,
                                             TextProducer tp,
                                             int zIndex)
        Draw some text on the current level

        Note: the order in which this is called relative to other actors will determine whether they go under or over this text.

        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of bottom left corner of the text
        y - Y coordinate of bottom left corner of the text
        zIndex - The z index of the image. There are 5 planes: -2, -2, 0, 1, and 2. By default, everything goes to plane 0

      • addTextCentered

        public edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Renderable addTextCentered(float centerX,
                                                     float centerY,
                                                     java.lang.String fontName,
                                                     java.lang.String fontColor,
                                                     int fontSize,
                                                     java.lang.String prefix,
                                                     java.lang.String suffix,
                                                     TextProducer tp,
                                                     int zIndex)
        Draw some text on the current level, centered on a point.

        Note: the order in which this is called relative to other actors will determine whether they go under or over this text.

        Parameters:
        centerX - X coordinate of center of the text
        centerY - Y coordinate of center of the text
        zIndex - The z index of the image. There are 5 planes: -2, -2, 0, 1, and 2. By default, everything goes to plane 0

        public int getRandom(int max)
        Generate a random number x such that 0 <= x < max
        Parameters:
        max - The largest number returned will be one less than max
        Returns:
        a random integer

      • getUnlockMode

        public boolean getUnlockMode()
        Report whether all levels should be treated as unlocked. This is useful in Chooser, where we might need to prevent some levels from being played.
